Key Arguments: The proposed legislation represents a massive overreach of government power.
An unelected government organization should not have the authority to decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Such powers could damage fundamental democratic rights.
The public should have access to all information to form their own opinions, which is essential for democracy and scientific discourse.
There is a risk of government using ACMA to push its agenda during crises.
Censorship will not lead to balanced outcomes and will increase public mistrust and societal division.
Notable Quotes: The bill that is proposed is extremely dangerous and represents a massive overreach of the government.
This power will erode the foundation of democracy at the deepest level.
The public needs the opportunity to decide their point of view based on ALL the information, that is how democracy works, indeed that is how science works.
Well done government on making things worse.
